title: SVGLinks

metadata.description: Learn about SVGLinks with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: SVG Links - The element is used to create a link. The element can be used with both text and graphics. The element has seven basic attributes: Attribute Description href The URL to go to download Tells the browser to download the URL instead of go to it hreflang The language of the page the link points to referrerpolicy The referrer to send when fetching the URL rel The relationship of the target object to the link object target Where to open the link. Can be _self, _parent, _top, _blank, or a name type The MIME type for the linked URL Text as a Hyperlink Text as a link (with the element): I love SVG! Sorry, your browser does not support inline SVG. Here is the SVG code: Example Code explanation: The href attribute defines the URL to go to The target attribute defines where to open the link (here the link will open in a new window/tab) Graphic as a Hyperlink A circle as a link (with the element): Sorry, your browser does not support inline SVG. Here is the SVG code: Example ★ +1

quiz.question: What is element?
options:
the SVG code:
Example
<svg height="30" width="200" xmlns="http://www
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of element is 'used to create a link'.

options:
the SVG code:
Example

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Here is 'the SVG code:
Example
<svg height="30" width="200" xmlns="http://www'.

summary: This tutorial covers SVGLinks concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SVGLinks effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SVGLinks and how to apply it in your projects.
